main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a luminous, cylindrical object over New Orleans, Louisiana on November 7, 1957. The object appeared to hover and then dart across the sky in different directions.
interesting points: The object was white in color and had a brilliant light that pulsated around the rim or edge.
The object was described as being several times larger than a commercial aircraft.
The object was observed for 15 minutes, during which it appeared to hover and then move at a high rate of speed, making sudden changes in direction.
The object was also observed by several aircraft operating out of the Moisant airport in New Orleans.
The conclusions indicate that the sighting was possibly a balloon or aircraft, but could not be definitively identified.
